metadata.titel_preek: Easter: Talking the Talk, Walking the Walk

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The transition from Easter proclamation (Talk) to social and physical restoration (Walk) through the agency of the church.

tekstueel_bewijs: The walk is accomplished by the apostles, that is, by the church.
It is the church’s business... to be about the Easter walk.
We are Easter people... empowered to raise others to new life.
perfect health for the lame beggar
deathly structures of greed can be transformed to life-givers
Easter... permits us to talk the talk
God’s good power for new life has been set loose
health care offered to the disadvantaged
share resources for life with those who lack
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Does hearer identify with Subject or Receiver?

tekstueel_bewijs: by faith in his name, his name itself has made this man strong
the walk cannot happen without the bold talk
helper.rol_van_god: Is God Subject, Helper, or absent?

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is primarily viewed as social systems (capitalism, greed) and psychological states (despair) rather than an ontological or cosmic power that only God can defeat.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Resurrection of Jesus by God.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: God
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon treats God's action as the 'Big Wonder' (past/foundational) which then mandates and empowers the 'Daily Wonder' (present/human action).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Easter Event → Perfect Health → The Disadvantaged
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Name of Jesus → The Church ← Deathly Structures of Greed

voorbeelden_god_subject: God’s good power for new life has been set loose.
The LORD hears when I call.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We sign on—yet again—to talk the talk.

voorbeelden: It is the church’s business... to be about the Easter walk.
The walk cannot happen without the bold talk!
We sign on—yet again—to talk the talk.
witnesses able to talk about what they have seen and know.
empowered to raise others to new life.
clothed with power from on high.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Empowerment' of the human subject. While it avoids pure legalism (Devoir), it shifts the 'Pouvoir' (Power) from God's ongoing action to the Church's delegated capacity.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Lame beggar/Greed) through ~S2 (Alms/Talk) to S1 (Perfect Health/Justice).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is achieved through the Church's 'Walk' which actualizes the 'Talk'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Moderate; death is seen as 'intimidation' rather than an inescapable ontological reality.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon starts with strong theocentric language regarding the Resurrection but pivots sharply to anthropocentric agency. It uses 'Grace' as a fuel for 'Moral/Social Action'.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The talk is accomplished by God... But the walk is accomplished by the apostles, that is, by the church.
The Easter power of God has been entrusted to God’s people to do the work.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God raised him from the dead.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The Apostles are models for the modern church's social activism.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on how the Risen Christ continues to heal the lame through his word, rather than how we must 'walk the walk' like Peter.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to perform 'Easter acts' to validate their faith.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Synergism: God did the big thing, now it's up to us to do the daily things.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from 'Talk' to 'Walk' is rhetorically smooth but theologically creates a gap where God stops acting and the Church takes over.
spanning_punten: The claim that 'the walk is accomplished by the church' contradicts the later quote that 'his name itself has made this man strong'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The Easter power of life is given... so that the deathly structures of greed can be transformed.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Moderate; sin is 'clinging to old tired modes of life'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully establishes God as the Subject of the past Resurrection but fails to maintain God as the Subject of the present restoration, handing the agency over to the Church.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The Church is the subject of 'walking' and 'raising'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Present the Risen Christ as the one who continues to walk and raise the lame through his people.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'The walk is accomplished by the church,' use 'The Risen Christ continues his walk in our streets today.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the 'Hero' who must fix capitalism/health care.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that we are all the lame beggar before we are ever Peter.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Heavy on Pouvoir (our power) and Devoir (our business).
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Focus on the 'Gift' (the Object being given by the Sender).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus more on the 'astonishment' of the crowd as a gift of grace rather than a recruitment for work.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Greed and despair are treated as bad habits or social ills.
tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Present Death as a cosmic enemy that only the 'Author of Life' can subdue.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: If the opponent is just 'greed', the subject can be 'the church'. If the opponent is 'Death', the subject must be 'God'.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The 'Secondary Program' (Ethics) is overshadowing the 'Fundamental Program' (Soteriology).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Ensure the 'Walk' is described as a fruit of the Spirit's work rather than the 'business' of the church.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically powerful and socially relevant, but it risks turning the Gospel into a 'to-do list' for social justice by making the Church the primary actant of the Easter 'Walk'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the 'Talk/Walk' alliteration is effective; semiotically, it creates a dangerous division of labor between God and Man.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis shows Peter saying 'Why do you stare at us... as if by our own power?'; the sermon's actantial structure suggests it IS the church's power/business.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that despite the 'Easter' vocabulary, the 'engine' of the sermon is the Church's performance, not God's ongoing act.

appendices.notities: The sermon leans heavily on the 'Moral Influence' model of the atonement.
